definition: Lin Biao (1908-1971), Chinese army leader at time of the Cultural Revolution
surname Lin/Japanese surname Hayashi
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
tiger stripes/tiger cub/(old) classifier for troops

sentences.english: Of these people, of course, include Lin Biao.
sentences.chinese: 這些人中當然也包括林彪。

sentences.english: He first gained the support of Lin Biao, which was what emboldened him to go ahead full steam.
sentences.chinese: 他首先得到林彪的支持，纔敢於放手這麼搞。

sentences.english: Of course, Lin Biao and the "Gang of four" is whether these.
sentences.chinese: 當然，林彪和“四人幫”是不管這些的。

sentences.english: Lin Biao also does not matter, he is my men.
sentences.chinese: 林彪也沒有什麼了不起，過去他是我的部下。

sentences.english: Chen's removal from the Standing Committee was also seen as a warning to Lin Biao.
sentences.chinese: 陳蓓驅逐出政治局也是在對林彪的警告。

definition: Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Su Yu (1907-1984), PLA commander
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
Chairman Mao/Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 (1893-1976), Chinese Communist leader
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Chen Zaidao (1909-1993), general in the People's Liberation Army
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Tan Zhenlin (1902-1983), PRC revolutionary and military leader, played political role after the Cultural Revolution
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
